examples: His family comes first.
Knowledge of cooking comes easy to him.
Come rain or shine.
After dinner comes the reckoning.
All good things come to an end.
words.defineEn: to reach or arrive at a particular place; to approach a specific place
words.defineVi: để tiếp cận hoặc đến một địa điểm cụ thể; tiếp cận một địa điểm cụ thể

examples: The Siemens display goes the whole hog.
The cruise went very quickly.
My laptop went haywire
To go swimming/fishing/jogging.
The email went to everyone in the company.
words.defineEn: to travel or move from one location to another location
words.defineVi: để đi du lịch hoặc di chuyển từ một địa điểm đến một địa điểm khác

examples: Take your pick.
His new world record will take some beating.
His apology took the edge off her anger.
Things like this take time.
The river took a meandering bend through the picturesque valley.
words.defineEn: to remove something or someone from a specific place
words.defineVi: để loại bỏ một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó từ một nơi cụ thể

examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
The day brings a sense of vitality and liveliness to the world.
The bad weather brought famine.
The revolution brought many changes.
Retirement often brings with it a massive drop in income.
words.defineEn: to take someone or something to a place or to come to a place with someone or something
words.defineVi: đưa ai đó hoặc cái gì đó đến một nơi hoặc đến một nơi với ai đó hoặc cái gì đó

examples: I want all of this cleaned up right now, or I'll take away your video games for the weekend.
This guy took away an electron.
Took away the one weapon in a consumer's arsenal.
Question number three, 'Does mental illness take away personal accountability?'
- Take away his internet access.
words.defineEn: provide food, drink, or items for take-out or delivery consumption
words.defineVi: cung cấp đồ ăn, thức uống hoặc các mặt hàng để mang đi hoặc giao hàng tận nơi

examples: Oh, once I get my hands on you, you'll take back what you said!
Later, Ali Baba's wife takes back the scales.
Take back pain for instance.
We have taken back control of our laws and our destiny.
Together, we are taking back our country.
words.defineEn: to return a purchased item to a seller or retailer in order to receive a refund or reimbursement
words.defineVi: để trả lại một mặt hàng đã mua cho người bán hoặc nhà bán lẻ để nhận được tiền hoàn lại hoặc bồi hoàn

examples: You're bringing together people of different generations.
We brought together 12 different databases with financial information, GIS information, depth information.
The Erlanger Heart and Lung Institute is bringing together experts from all over the world.
These enzymes bring together a phosphate with ADP, to create another ATP molecule for each pyruvate.
When drive-thrus first became a thing in the 1950s, they brought together two of American's favorite things: cars and fast food.
words.defineEn: to make people become closer together or become friendlier, or to help them end their argument
words.defineVi: để làm cho mọi người trở nên gần nhau hơn hoặc trở nên thân thiện hơn, hoặc để giúp họ kết thúc cuộc tranh luận của họ

words.defineEn: to transition from being awake to being asleep
words.defineVi: để chuyển từ thức sang ngủ

words.defineEn: to become a reality or be realized, typically in reference to a previously hoped for or desired outcome
words.defineVi: để trở thành hiện thực hoặc được thực hiện, thường liên quan đến một kết quả mong muốn hoặc hy vọng trước đó

examples: Double cream adds indulgence to creamy pasta sauces.
His parents did a double take when he came home with a tattoo.
The kitchen had a double oven, allowing for simultaneous baking of different dishes.
Take your hot beverages to the next level by adding a splash of double cream to them.
When the price of skiing doubled, tourists voted with their feet and just stopped going.
words.defineEn: to make something experience a twofold increase
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó kinh nghiệm tăng gấp đôi

examples: Must be coincidence.
There are no coincidences.
It's no coincidence.
It's just a coincidence.
That was just a coincidence.
words.defineEn: a situation in which two things happen simultaneously by chance that is considered unusual
words.defineVi: một tình huống trong đó hai điều xảy ra đồng thời một cách tình cờ được coi là bất thường

examples: The classroom has rows of chairs for students.
United won four games in a row.
You've missed your mark three times in a row.
After the row in a pub he drove off in a huff.
With two wins in a row, our team is on course for the championship title.
words.defineEn: a sequence of related items, events, or actions that follow one after the other in a particular order
words.defineVi: một chuỗi các mục, sự kiện hoặc hành động liên quan nối tiếp nhau theo một thứ tự cụ thể

examples: The little kid flipped the cop the bird and didn't even know what it meant.
I remember when we thought that flip phones were the best thing since sliced bread.
Flip that scenario around.
That side flip.
Flip the premise.
words.defineEn: to turn over quickly with a sudden move
words.defineVi: để lật lại một cách nhanh chóng với một di chuyển đột ngột

examples: An ostrich strategy for covid-19 is too risky.
That investment is too risky.
They know the consequences but still engage in risky behavior.
The entrepreneur shot for the moon by pursuing a risky business venture that had the potential for huge rewards.
I know it's risky, but if I'm going to get in trouble anyway, I might as well be hanged for a sheep as a lamb.
words.defineEn: having the potential of loss, danger, harm, or failure
words.defineVi: có khả năng mất mát, nguy hiểm, tổn hại hoặc thất bại

examples: A lack of investment in education can breed ignorance and apathy in a society.
Lack of oversight allowed overzealous investment bankers to play Old Harry with the economy.
The plant was growing weakly due to lack of sunlight.
They lacked experience sure, but Manfred knocked them into shape.
He was piqued by her lack of attention.
words.defineEn: the absence or insufficiency of something, often implying a deficiency or shortage
words.defineVi: sự vắng mặt hoặc thiếu sót của một cái gì đó, thường ám chỉ sự thiếu hụt hoặc thiếu hụt

words.defineEn: used to describe the typical or average value or amount based on a set of data or observations
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để mô tả giá trị hoặc số lượng điển hình hoặc trung bình dựa trên một tập hợp dữ liệu hoặc quan sát

examples: That does sound logical.
They make no logical geographical sense.
For Donald Trump, the next logical step was buying an airline.
We're very logical creatures.
So we did the next logical step.
words.defineEn: capable of following rules of logic and forming ideas based on facts that are true
words.defineVi: có khả năng tuân theo các quy tắc logic và hình thành ý tưởng dựa trên các sự kiện có thật

examples: William was a gambler, ready to try his luck at anything.
Internet gambling is crack cocaine for gamblers.
I'm not a gambler.
He's not a gambler.
Nobody becomes a problem gambler after the first time you gamble.
words.defineEn: a person who participates in games of chance or bets on uncertain outcomes, often with the aim of winning money or other prizes
words.defineVi: một người tham gia vào các trò chơi may rủi hoặc đặt cược vào những kết quả không chắc chắn, thường với mục đích giành được tiền hoặc các giải thưởng khác

examples: Though his staff is often confused by the way he runs the office, I've found that there's method in his madness.
Most people confuse Elon's management style with his vision in a sense.
They also sometimes confuse their own actions with the actions of other people.
Travelers and railroad workers were confused by the many local sun times.
I'm confusing the two signs.
words.defineEn: to create confusion or uncertainty in the mind
words.defineVi: để tạo ra sự nhầm lẫn hoặc không chắc chắn trong tâm trí
